intro: Phyllagathis guidongensis, commonly known as the Guidong stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant typically features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
